articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Idrees Ali, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and leaders of other NATO member states are poised to unveil new aid and reiterate a membership pledge for Ukraine at a summit in Washington after the U.S. leader vowed to defend Kyiv against Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Biden, NATO poised to unveil Ukraine aid, reiterate membership pledge at summit

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Jeff Mason, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden faced fresh doubts on Wednesday about his re-election chances from two heavyweights who may influence other Democratic lawmakers and financial donors: Nancy Pelosi and George Clooney.
articles.title: Biden allies Pelosi, Clooney raise fresh doubts about his reelection chance

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A backlog of 1,150 truckloads of humanitarian aid is waiting to be collected from the Palestinian side of the Kerem Shalom crossing in the southern Gaza Strip, Israel said on Wednesday, prompting the United Nations to say: "We're doing what we can."
articles.title: Israel cites aid backlog in Gaza; UN says: 'We're doing what we can'

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed their offensive in north and central Gaza on Wednesday, hours after an airstrike on a tent encampment that Palestinian officials said killed more than two dozen people and as negotiations to end the fighting were set to resume.
articles.title: Israel presses Gaza offensive hours after deadly airstrike on tent camp

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States will resume shipping 500-pound bombs to Israel but will continue to hold back on supplying 2,000-pound bombs over concerns about their use in Gaza, a U.S. official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US to resume shipping 500-pound bombs to Israel, US official says

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelinskiy returned to the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday to cement relationships with lawmakers who will vote on future U.S. aid for his country, which could be in jeopardy if former President Donald Trump is reelected.
articles.title: Zelenskiy returns to Congress to bolster relationships amid worries of Trump return

articles.author: Benoit Van Overstraeten, Zhifan Liu
articles.description: Leaders from the left-wing bloc that topped France's legislative election on Sunday and the runner-up centrists continued on Wednesday a frenzied race to try to put together rival bids to form a viable government.
articles.title: French left and centrists tussle to form government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police said on Wednesday they had located a man wanted in connection with the murder of three women, the wife and two daughters of a BBC horse racing commentator, in an incident believed to have involved a crossbow.
articles.title: UK police locate suspect in triple murder of BBC commentator's family

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: The Alternative for Germany (AFD) joined forces with other far-right parties to form a third far-right party alliance in the European Parliament on Wednesday, a group member said.
articles.title: Germany's spurned AfD creates third far-right EU parliament group

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will tell NATO leaders on Thursday they must send a clear message to Russian President Vladimir Putin of unity in their support for Ukraine, and he re-committed to delivering a 3 billion pound military aid package for Kyiv.
articles.title: UK's Starmer urges NATO unity for Ukraine, pledges military aid
